page.title: 12Local History and Notables
page.content: In local times a British hill fort was in the village.The Romans built a road through our area from Lewes to London in order to serve local iron workings.Last year we looked at a Roman pottery found in the village. English kings used the forest to hunt deer.John of Gaunt and Henry the eighth hunted here.Iron workings were resumed in Tudor times making Hartfield important. In those days there were 3 corn water mills,2 survive today.Bolebroke Castle is reputed to be the oldest brick building in Ssussex. In modern times A.A.Milne lived in Cotchford Lane and the 500 acre wood and Ashdown Forest are the setting for the 'Winnie the Pooh' stories, on of the foot paths crosses Pooh Bridge. There are many old buildings in the centre of Hartfield, 300 yrs. old.
